definition: horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]
abbr. for Sichuan Province 四川[Si4 chuan1] in southwest China
Taming of the Shrew, play by William Shakespeare

sentences.english: The best horse needs breeding, and the aptest child needs teaching.
sentences.chinese: 最好的馬要馴，最伶俐的孩子要教。

sentences.english: The annual bull-taming festival is celebrated as part of the south Indian harvest festival of Pongal.
sentences.chinese: 馴牛節是慶祝收穫的奶粥節的一部份。

sentences.english: The "stunned" zombie is not allowed totag a human for a predetermined length of time.
sentences.chinese: 暈匭馴的殭屍在預訂時間內不能再傳染人類。

sentences.english: Choose a couple from The Taming of the Shrew or Don Quixote to discuss.
sentences.chinese: 在《馴悍記》或《堂吉訶德》中選擇一對男女作討論。

sentences.english: Everything depended ultimately upon the driving power of human muscle, the muscle of ignorant and subjugated men.
sentences.chinese: 事事最終要靠愚昧的馴從者的肌肉的推動力。

sentences.english: Whitehead hero breaking the sea, the youth haoqi qianshan mountain.
sentences.chinese: 白首壯心馴大海，青春浩氣走千山。

sentences.english: Shi Benjian, lubrication for compliant breaking, from love.
sentences.chinese: 石本堅，潤滑柔順者爲馴，更引人喜歡。

sentences.english: Thee best horse needs breeding, and the aptest child needs teaching.
sentences.chinese: 最好的馬要馴，最伶俐的孩子要教。

sentences.english: Pongal is a harvest festival celebrated by Tamils across the world. (AP Photo/Rafiq Maqbool)
sentences.chinese: 馴牛節是全世界泰米爾人歡慶豐收的節日。

sentences.english: The best horse needs breaking, and the aptest child needs teaching. (prov. )
sentences.chinese: 最好的馬要馴，最聰明的孩子也要訓。

definition: load carried by a pack animal
to comfort/to console/to stroke/to caress/an old term for province or provincial governor
to run fast/to speed/to gallop/to disseminate/to spread
to cry (of birds, animals and insects)/to make a sound/to voice (one's gratitude, grievance etc)
